result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas M. Burris

Case Called: 9:45 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Defendant states that he has been in contact with the SPD Office and he should be eligible. 
Court denies appointment of counsel at this time.
C: Branch 5 File. 
Adj: 9:45 am

Pre-trial conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 14, 2022 at 10:20 am.
Jury status hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Jury Trial on January 24, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:45 am.
Defendant appears in person. 

Date & time set for Indigency Hearing. 
N.M.B. sworn and testifies. 
Court questions defendant RE: Employment/Income. 

Due to employment changes, Court directs defendant to contact SPD again. 
IH to be set for 8/15 at 9:30 in branch 1. 

Adj: 9:48 am.
Indigency hearing on August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): W.S.F. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:10 pm.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears from MCJ, with Attorney Peter Vu and Krista Cannon.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

W.F. makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s):  W.S.F. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol and controlled substances unless prescribed. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
